page.title: 17History of Wrelton and Dis.
page.content: Pickering's western neighbours along the A170 are Middleton, Aislaby, Wrelton and Sinnington.It is often pointed out that the initials of these five towns can be taken and arranged into the word SWAMP, and indeed this area was once wet and swampy. Wrelton is said to mean"hill where felons were executed"and indeed there is a Gallowshead lane not far away.The village of Wrelton marks the junction of the westward road from Pickering with the Roman road,which probably forms its northerly town street.A small village green marks the actual crossing.This green is surrounded by Georgian farms and houses.There is a restored "cruck" building of 1665.On the main road is the "Buck Inn",sole survivor of several old alehouses that once served the stagecoach route.
